raw_comment:
1. I notice that several first world countries have over 50% of 15-24 year olds that believe that the world is getting better with each generation.

2. I wonder why specifically Indonesia has such a vast amount of 15-24 year olds that believe the world is getting better with each generation.

3. This relates to my community in that I am a high schooler that is consistently surrounded by people in the age range that is sampled in the graph. My generation will be responsible for changing the world for the better, so this directly relates to my life. Most often, I hear that people have a hopeful and optimistic outlook of what will become of the world when my generation goes into the work force and becomes active citizens.

4. The graph displays the percentage of 15-24 year olds in different parts of the world that believe that each generation will positively impact the globe. First world counties tend to have higher percentages while second and third world countries usually have a lower percentage of people with this opinion. A headline for the graph is, "The Next Generation: Will They Change the World?"
ace_sentences: I notice that several first-world countries have more than 50% of 15-24-year-olds.
These 15-24-year-olds believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
I wonder why Indonesia has a very high percentage of 15-24-year-olds.
These 15-24-year-olds in Indonesia believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
This relates to my community.
I am a high school student.
I am consistently surrounded by people who are 15-24 years old.
The graph samples people who are 15-24 years old.
My generation will be responsible for changing the world for the better.
This directly relates to my life.
I often hear a claim.
The claim is that people have a hopeful outlook about the world.
The claim is that people have an optimistic outlook about the world.
My generation will enter the workforce in the future.
My generation will become active citizens in the future.
The graph displays a percentage for each part of the world.
Each percentage is the percentage of 15-24-year-olds in that part of the world.
These 15-24-year-olds believe that each generation will positively impact the globe.
First-world countries tend to have higher percentages.
Second-world countries tend to have lower percentages.
Third-world countries tend to have lower percentages.
The headline for the graph is: The Next Generation: Will They Change the World?
